Author: akkartik
Content:
news.yc doesn't allow searching ideas either.

Also, we need some way to search only 'idea' posts. Perhaps if news.yc had tags that would suffice, but otherwise this may deserve a different namespace. Not something one reads everyday but more of a tool to submit or search for ideas.

Author: paul
Title: Paul Buchheit: What if I could not only change the way things are, but the way things have always been?

Author: aston
Content:
A ton of them aren't even shortsighted:

"I think there is a world market for maybe five computers."\n Thomas Watson, chairman of IBM, 1943

At the time, there wasn't even that large of a market. Watson definitely wasn't panning the technology, just noting (correctly) that the time wasn't right for a marketing push.

Great ideas implemented too early aren't worth much at all.

Author: felipe
Content: We rent a coworking space in SF, and it was very beneficial. A bunch of startups share the same space, and we are constantly exchanging information, ideas, contacts, etc... I think that's the most important thing about coworking: It's not much about the space itself, but about the community formed around the shared space.

Author: jward
Content: I'm not really sure what this has to do with startups.  Perhaps reddit or digg would be a better place?

Author: danw
Content: Splashpower and powerbeam work differently. Splash power recharges devices wirelessly in a way that is more useful than powerbeam. I've been waiting a long time to get splashpower in my phone, ipod, etc but still no sign of it :(
